# Perch

> A beautiful terminal social client for Mastodon & Bluesky

Perch is a Rust-based terminal application for browsing and posting to decentralized social networks. Read your timeline, post updates, and engage with content across Mastodon and Bluesky — all from a gorgeous TUI.

## Quick Facts

- **Type:** Command-line application / TUI
- **Language:** Rust
- **License:** MIT
- **Platforms:** macOS, Linux, Windows
- **Repository:** https://github.com/ricardodantas/perch
- **Documentation:** https://perch.ricardodantas.me/docs
- **Author:** Ricardo Dantas
- **Themes:** 15 built-in color themes

## Installation

### Homebrew (macOS/Linux)
```bash
brew install ricardodantas/tap/perch
```

### Cargo (all platforms)
```bash
cargo install perch
```

### Binary Downloads
Pre-built binaries available at: https://github.com/ricardodantas/perch/releases

## Key Features

- **Mastodon Integration**: Full OAuth authentication with any instance
- **Bluesky Support**: AT Protocol support with app passwords
- **Cross-Posting**: Post to multiple networks simultaneously
- **Beautiful TUI**: Three-panel interface with 15 color themes
- **Vim Keybindings**: Navigate with familiar j/k, tabs, and shortcuts
- **Secure Storage**: Credentials stored in system keyring
- **Offline Cache**: Browse cached posts without network
- **Auto-Update**: Built-in update checker with one-key update

## Architecture

Perch supports two modes:
- **TUI Mode**: Interactive terminal interface for browsing and posting
- **CLI Mode**: Script-friendly commands for automation

## Usage

```bash
# Add a Mastodon account
perch auth mastodon mastodon.social

# Add a Bluesky account
perch auth bluesky

# Launch the TUI
perch

# Post from CLI
perch post "Hello world!"

# View timeline in CLI
perch timeline
```

## Configuration

Config file: `~/.config/perch/config.toml`

### Example Configuration

```toml
# Theme (15 options available)
theme = "dracula"

# Default post visibility
default_visibility = "public"

# Default networks to post to
default_networks = ["mastodon", "bluesky"]

# Number of posts to fetch
post_limit = 50
```

## Supported Networks

### Mastodon
- OAuth authentication
- Any instance supported
- Home timeline, notifications
- Post, reply, like, boost
- Content warnings

### Bluesky
- App password authentication
- AT Protocol support
- Home timeline
- Post, reply, like, repost

## Themes

15 themes available:
- Catppuccin (Mocha, Latte)
- Dracula, Nord, Gruvbox Dark/Light
- Tokyo Night, Monokai Pro
- Solarized Dark/Light, One Dark Pro
- Everforest, Rosé Pine, Kanagawa, Cyberpunk

## Keyboard Shortcuts (TUI)

### Navigation
- `j`/`k` or `↑`/`↓`: Navigate items
- `h`/`l` or `←`/`→`: Switch panels
- `Tab`: Switch views
- `1`/`2`: Jump to Timeline/Accounts
- `g`/`G`: Go to first/last

### Timeline Actions
- `n`: Compose new post
- `R`: Reply to post
- `r`: Repost/unrepost
- `L`: Like/unlike
- `b`: Refresh
- `o`: Open in browser
- `f`: Cycle network filter
- `/`: Search

### Compose
- `F1`/`F2`: Toggle Mastodon/Bluesky
- `Ctrl+S`: Send post
- `Enter`: New line
- `Esc`: Cancel

### General
- `t`: Theme picker
- `?`: Help
- `A`: About
- `U`: Update (if available)
- `q`: Quit

## CLI Commands

```bash
# Posting
perch post "Hello world!"
perch post "Hello Fediverse!" --to mastodon
perch post "Spoilers!" --cw "Movie spoilers"

# Timeline
perch timeline
perch timeline mastodon
perch timeline --limit 50

# Accounts
perch accounts
perch accounts remove <id>

# Authentication
perch auth mastodon <instance>
perch auth bluesky
```
